biogHist.abstract: The Normal School, opened in 1850 on the corner of Pedder and Carlton Streets, New Town. It was designed to offer an academic education to boys and good quality teacher training. Teachers also took classes with the boys at the Queen's Orphan Asylum. The Legislative Council refused to fund the School and it closed in 1852. Ten years later, the Hobart Town Female Refuge opened in the same building. It later became the Industrial School for Girls - Hobart.

chronItem.event: Location - The Normal School was on the corner of Pedder and Carlton Streets, New Town

descriptiveNote.p: The Anchorage Home was in the former Normal School, Peddar Street, between 1894 and 1920.
The teachers from the Normal School gave lessons to some of the boys at Queen's Orphan Asylum.
The Industrial School for Girls opened as the Hobart Town Female Refuge in the former Normal School.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Newspaper Article: Letters to the editor: the Anchorage Home

archref.repository: Tasmanian Images: Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office
archref.unittitle: The Normal School, later the Hobart Town Female Refuge, and then the Anchorage Home - window detail
archref.abstract: This photograph was taken just before the demolition of the Normal School in 1962. The building of the former Normal School was the first home of the Hobart Town Female Refuge. It became the Industrial School for Girls - Hobart.
archref.note: Reproduction rights owned by the Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office
